hypothesis_content.title: CEX/DeFi Liquidity Migration → Volatility Regime Predictor
hypothesis_content.statement: When CEX BTC bid-ask spreads widen by >15% while DeFi (Perp DEX) spreads remain stable or tighten, expect increased volatility (20-day RV >55%) within 3 days as liquidity fragmentation precedes price discovery events.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Divergence between CEX and DeFi liquidity indicates institutional vs. retail behavior split. CEX widening suggests institutional liquidity withdrawal while DeFi stability shows retail engagement - this mismatch creates volatility as markets seek new equilibrium.
entry_conditions: Top 3 CEX average spread increase >15% over 24 hours
Major Perp DEX (GMX, dYdX) spreads change <±5%
BTC price within ±3% of 20-day moving average
No major news/scheduled events within 24 hours

exit_conditions.take_profit: 20-day realized volatility reaches 60% OR 5% profit on long volatility position
exit_conditions.stop_loss: CEX spreads normalize within 24 hours without volatility expansion

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Spread divergence occurs 3+ times without subsequent volatility expansion.
